image.altText: A black and white photograph of a glacier from satellite imagery.

props.synopsis: Antarctic scientists have documented the fastest retreat of a glacier in modern history, after it lost eight kilometres of ice in just two months, according to a new report.

title.children: Antarctic glacier shrinks at fastest pace in modern history

image.altText: A portable electric heater on the floor with a person's feet warming up next to it

props.synopsis: The federal government says its new Solar Sharer scheme will also benefit Australians who aren't able to access it, but some experts are hesitant to agree.

title.children: Who gets free power — and who misses out — under the new energy offer

image.altText: A large, roofed circular stadium near Hobart's CBD, seen from the air.

props.synopsis: After years of talk, the process to decide the fate of the contentious $1.13 billion stadium at Macquarie Point is finally under way. Here's how it will all unfold.

title.children: Hobart stadium order tabled in parliament — here's what happens next

image.altText: A man wearing sunglasses with glitter up their cheekbones.

props.synopsis: For the LGBTQIA+ community, queer pubs and clubs can be an oasis. But in some capital cities they are vanishing.

title.children: Hobart among three capitals with no queer bars, as Canberra club set to shut

image.altText: Sunrise over a silhouetted jetty and calm water.

props.synopsis: For some residents of Tasmania's east coast, it is either leave the region or risk being homeless as they grapple with a scarcity of long-term rentals.

title.children: 'The very best place in Australia' is running out of homes

image.altText: A man stands inside a house, looking out the window with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Former gambling addict Mark Kempster says betting advertising has a huge impact on him. He has thrown his support behind proposed reform which would ban advertising and sponsorship across state-owned or funded venues.

title.children: LISTEN: For Mark, being able to watch sport without gambling advertising would be life-changing

image.altText: A politician gathers for a press conference

props.synopsis: Tasmania's public housing waiting list has blown out to 5,336, and Housing Minister Kerry Vincent says the rising cost of buying or building a home is putting more people on the list.

title.children: LISTEN: Housing Minister disagrees government is failing at delivering homes

image.altText: a skip bin with salmon carcasses

props.synopsis: The state's environment watchdog has released a debrief of lessons and reflections from a mass salmon mortality event in which dead fish washed up on Tasmanian beaches.

title.children: Environment regulator releases report on mass salmon deaths

image.altText: A close up of Michelle Bullock.

props.synopsis: A Cup Day rate cut is widely expected to be off the agenda when the RBA board delivers its latest decision this afternoon. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: RBA raises inflation forecasts but 'not hitting panic button just yet'

image.altText: A street sign that reads "Wall St". A US flag is visible behind it.

props.synopsis: Last week the RBA governor issued a blunt warning on the state of financial markets and as markets continue to shift from traditional valuation methods, plenty of cool heads are getting nervous.

title.children: A key measure of stock market health is now flashing red

image.altText: A man smiling.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has thrust the Democrats into the political wilderness but an uprising in the gritty streets of New York may be their future.

title.children: Why a 'radical' Democrat socialist is causing waves in the United States

image.altText: A woman with long wavy brown hair, wearing a navy lace top, standing in a suburban street.

props.synopsis: I want to reflect on what I have come to see, through my own experience, as both the illuminating strengths and the shadowed weaknesses of the Australian legal system and its role in our democracy.

title.children: At the heart of the constitution, there lies an historic and structural wound

image.altText: A close-up of a bag of blue pills, held by hands in blue gloves.

props.synopsis: Police charge 18 people in Perth and Sydney and seize 268 kilograms of illicit drugs following a multi-agency investigation into a national crime syndicate.

title.children: 'Put them out of business': Police seize $60 million of drugs in major bust

image.altText: Italian police officers in black clothes and berets standing guard in front of the Torre dei Conti, seen between two tree trunks

props.synopsis: A Romanian worker who was trapped for hours under rubble in Rome after the partial collapse of a 787-year-old medieval tower near the Colosseum has died, according to local media.

title.children: Worker dies after being rescued from Italian medieval tower collapse

image.altText: man with white wound dressings around his eye helps carry a coffin on a metal scaffold. marigold flowes on coffin.

props.synopsis: A passenger who walked from a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner crash that killed his brother soon after take-off tells UK media of the mental and physical anguish he has endured since.

title.children: Lone survivor of Air India crash says 'God took all my happiness'

image.altText: A hill with a coal mine cut out of the side.

props.synopsis: BHP will transfer 3,700 hectares of land at the Mt Arthur coal mine to a neighbouring mining company looking to expand its operations, raising questions about its promise to close the mine by 2030.

title.children: BHP accused of backflipping on closure of NSW's biggest coal mine

image.altText: Police push back an angry crowd of protesters

props.synopsis: Dozens of demonstrators from Palestine Action Group rallied outside the Sydney International Convention Centre on Tuesday morning.

title.children: Thirteen arrested as pro-Palestinian protesters clash with police at defence expo

image.altText: A large blue sculpture with googly eyes on it at night

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old woman appears in court via telephone accused of damaging Mount Gambier's Cast in Blue sculpture, which has drawn criticism for its cost and appearance.

title.children: Woman in court for putting googly eyes on controversial 'Blue Blob' sculpture

image.altText: A woman wearing an outlandish hat

props.synopsis: The 165th running of the Melbourne Cup is set to be a soggy one, as rain drenches the city ahead of the race that stops a nation.

title.children: Fashion lights up Flemington for the Melbourne Cup

image.altText: Jofra Archer on the cricket field pointing with both hands, Ben Stokes rests his hands on JArcher's shoulders

props.synopsis: England is urged to play both Jofra Archer and Mark Wood to begin the Ashes in Perth despite durability concerns with both quicks.

title.children: Aussie great urges England to unleash pacemen despite injury concerns

image.altText: NOLb_EskSolar_0211

props.synopsis: If solar panels at your property sustain hail damage, is there anything you can do to avoid further problems?

title.children: Giant hail left SEQ solar panels with gaping holes. Here's what you can do

image.altText: Andrew "Twiggy" Forrest stands in front of the upside-down weir he has developed beneath the Ashburton River on Minderoo

props.synopsis: Mining billionaire Andrew Forrest's controversial plan to alter the natural river system on his large outback WA cattle station is under renewed legal scrutiny.

title.children: Billionaire Forrest begins fresh legal bid to alter sacred river in WA's north

image.altText: Men in military attire holding shields with a person and a dog appearing behind them

props.synopsis: Israel's top military lawyer is behind bars after leaking a video of shocking alleged abuse of a Palestinian man in a military jail. This is why the case has shaken politics and the military to the core.

title.children: A leaked video showed an alleged abuse. It has sparked a political fight in Israel

image.altText: A house is seen surrounded by flood waters

props.synopsis: A report from IAG and a scientific research centre finds escalating risk from severe weather events in south-east Queensland, New South Wales, and south-west Western Australia.

title.children: Insurer calls for climate action as severe weather drives premiums up

image.altText: Sophie Tilley with a picture of her children.

props.synopsis: Sophie Tilley says she arrived at her son's child care to be told an "older man in shorts" had already collected him.

title.children: Sydney mum recounts 'panic' when day care wrongly gave son to another person

image.altText: toilet paper lines the toilet seat

props.synopsis: Public toilets are a "microbial soup" and there are things you should be doing to protect yourself — including not taking out your mobile phone and never hovering over the seat.

title.children: Beware the 'Trojan horse' of germs in public toilets

image.altText: A crowd of tourists taking photos outside Beijing Railway Station

props.synopsis: The extension, which is until the end of 2026, covers 32 European countries as well as Australia, New Zealand, Japan, South Korea and several nations in South America and the Gulf region.

title.children: China extends visa-free entry for 45 countries, including Australia

image.altText: A grainy CCTV image showing someone wearing black walk in a car park

props.synopsis: Police are investigating possible links between a man accused of a mass stabbing on an English train and a series of other incidents.

title.children: UK train stabbing suspect also charged over incident at London Tube station

image.altText: A green, beige, blue and white map showing the location of Mount Yalung Ri in red next to Mount Everest and Kathmandu in black

props.synopsis: An avalanche on Mount Yalung Ri has killed five foreign climbers, whose nationalities are yet to be confirmed, and two Nepali guides, while at least five others were injured at the mountain's base camp.

title.children: Avalanche on Nepal mountain kills at least seven, officials say

image.altText: Uncle Wayne is wearing a bright red shirt and white hat and smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: "Discriminatory" changes to means testing in aged care could leave Stolen Generations survivors having to pay high fees for basic everyday services.

title.children: Stolen Generations elders worried about aged care reforms

image.altText: Dan Tehan and Angus Taylor

props.synopsis: The Coalition will gather this morning at a joint party room session as the issue of whether to keep or ditch its net zero commitment roils within the party.

title.children: Coalition to meet after Nationals lead charge to dump net zero

image.altText: A close-up photo of destruction to Afghanistan's Blue Mosque after an earthquake

props.synopsis: The centuries-old Blue Mosque site, one of Afghanistan's most revered religious landmarks, is a major gathering place during Islamic and cultural festivals.

title.children: Earthquake kills at least 20, damages Afghanistan's ancient Blue Mosque

image.altText: A feral pig stands near a trap.

props.synopsis: Neville Mattick says feral pigs are eating the lambs on his farm in the NSW Central West, with fewer than one in 100 surviving this season.

title.children: Feral pigs are eating 99 out of every 100 lambs on this NSW property

image.altText: An illustration of an egg being inseminated, viewed under a microscope.

props.synopsis: In an email seen by the ABC, a US-based egg bank told IVF clinics it was introducing its new "Client Success Reward Program in Australia".

title.children: IVF 'reward' scheme proposed by egg and sperm bank sparks concern

image.altText: Conjoined newborn twins lie amongst blankets in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Conjoined twins are extraordinarily rare, accounting for fewer than every two in 100,000 births.

title.children: PNG conjoined twins should not be separated due to risk of death, hospital says
